src:
Prediksi Borussia Monchengladbach vs AS Roma 8 November 2019
06 Nov 2019, 16:01 by Bola.net
Bola.net - Persaingan di Grup J masih sangat terbuka. AS Roma berada di tempat teratas, tapi cuma unggul tiga poin atas Borussia Monchengladbach di posisi terbawah. Tiga matchday tersisa pun bakal sangat krusial.
Pemimpin klasemen AS Roma akan melawat ke Jerman untuk menghadapi tim juru kunci Borussia Monchengladbach pada matchday 4 Grup J Liga Europa 2019/20, Jumat (8/11/2019).
Pada matchday sebelumnya, yang merupakan pertemuan perdana mereka, Roma ditahan imbang Monchengladbach 1-1 di Italia. Giallorossi unggul melalui gol Nicolo Zaniolo pada menit 32, tapi tim tamu bisa membalas lewat penalti Lars Stindl di injury time.
Roma sementara memimpin klasemen dengan 5 poin, diikuti Istanbul Basaksehir (4), Wolfsberger (4), dan Monchengladbach (2).
Di Bundesliga akhir pekan kemarin, Monchengladbach mengalahkan tuan rumah Bayer Leverkusen 2-1 lewat gol-gol Oscar Wendt dan Marcus Thuram. Hasil itu membuat pasukan Marco Rose memimpin klasemen sementara Bundesliga dengan keunggulan tiga poin atas Borussia Dortmund di peringkat dua.
Dari Serie A, Roma baru saja meraih kemenangan impresif 2-1 menjamu Napoli. Zanilo menyumbang satu gol, sedangkan Jordan Veretout menyarangkan satu dari titik penalti. Itu menjadi modal berharga Giallorossi untuk menantang Die Fohlen di Borussia-Park nanti.
text:
Prediction of Borussia Monchengladbach vs AS Roma 8 November 2019
Nov 6 2019, 16:01 by Bola.net
Bola.net - Competition in Group J is still very open. AS Roma is in the top spot, but only three points ahead of Borussia Monchengladbach at the bottom. The remaining three matchday will be very crucial.
Leaders AS Roma will travel to Germany to face Borussia Monchengladbach's key team on Matchday 4 Group J Europa League 2019/20, Friday (11/08/2019).
On the previous matchday, which was their first meeting, Roma were held to a 1-1 draw with Monchengladbach in Italy. The Giallorossi took the lead through Nicolo Zaniolo's goal on 32 minutes, but the visitors were able to retaliate through Lars Stindl's penalty in injury time.
Roma meanwhile lead the standings with 5 points, followed by Istanbul Basaksehir (4), Wolfsberger (4) and Monchengladbach (2).
In the Bundesliga last weekend, Monchengladbach defeated host Bayer Leverkusen 2-1 with goals from Oscar Wendt and Marcus Thuram. The result left Marco Rose's men leading the Bundesliga standings with a three-point advantage over Borussia Dortmund in second place.
From Serie A, Roma have just won an impressive 2-1 win at Napoli. Zanilo contributed one goal, while Jordan Veretout netted one from the penalty spot. It was a valuable capital of the Giallorossi to challenge Die Fohlen at Borussia-Park later.
